column2: NY DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column10: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 2. If you are charged with DWI within __ years of having been convicted of either AGG-DWI, DWI, DWAI-Drug, or DWAI-Combination, you can be charged with felony DWI.
3. Under New York State’s “zero tolerance” law, it is a violation for a person under 21 to drive with:
column4: a BAC of more than .05 percent
column6: a BAC of more than .08 percent
column8: a BAC of more than .15 percent
column10: any BAC that can be measured (.02 to .07).

column2: 4. The picture shows:
5. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 6. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
7. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 8. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column8: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 9. DMV will deny any application for reinstatement of a revoked license if the applicant has _____ or more alcohol/drug related driving convictions in his/her lifetime.
10. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column10: means that you need to stop.

column2: 11. “Expressway” means:
column4: a road without a median, regardless of the number of lanes.
column6: a road with one or two lanes arranged within a single carriageway with no median to separate traffic.
column8: any divided highway where traffic moves in one direction on two or more lanes.
column10: any undivided highway where traffic moves in two directions.

column2: 12. Can you receive a ticket for disobeying directions given by a flagger?
column4: No, flaggers are not law enforcement officers.
column6: Yes, but only if there are no road signs.
column8: No, a flagger does not have the same authority as a sign.
column10: Yes, flaggers have the same authority as a sign.

column2: 13. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 14. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in New York City is __ MPH.
15. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
16. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 17. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 18. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 19. Parking is not allowed within __ feet of a traffic light, STOP sign or YIELD sign.
20. A flashing red light means:
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.
